title: Duskblade of Draktharr
body: This item is ruining the game. It should cost 6k gold for the benefits that it gives. The two uniques passives alone are like two separate items. It needs to be nerfed really hard. Every AD rushes it and becomes unstoppable.

replies.body:
Trying to balance it at this point is a lost cause.

It needs to be removed entirely.

>
> Trying to balance it at this point is a lost cause.
> 
> It needs to be removed entirely.

No. Its _damage_ is actually on par with its counterparts. 
What makes the item _strong_ is the free sweeper that it gives you. Get rid of that, and the item becomes pretty nice. 

If riot really wants anti-vision, they need to add it to edge of night. Ward camo would be a pretty unique mechanic.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/6uabQq9E-lets-compare-duskblade-to-other-damage-procs
It has quite a few peers. 
In fact, damage wise, its actually weaker than some due to its being unseen requirement. 
Energized is more reliable and can proc more easily MANY more times in a fight. 
Titanic hydra is better at almost every stage of the game. 
Ravenous hydra is better with over 200AD. 
Trinity force is better with over 100base AD. 

Yeah... The damage component of dusk blade is actually very average. Its really just the sweeper passive that makes it to strong.

Edit; 
Well... Ward camo isnt getting rid of the ward, so theres counterplay there at least. Like i said; it'd just be an interesting mechanic.

What i mean by ward camo is making it so, during the shield duration of edge of night, wards dont see you but players can. In this way it retains its use, stays pre-meditated, and doesnt break the item due to situational use. 
The current automagic sweeper is quite generalist.

> [{quoted}](name=Paroe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OAU8xe6U,comment-id=000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-08-10T09:11:02.464+0000)

273 from Duskblade versus 280 from a Shiv crit.

273 from Duskblade versus 140 from RFC.

The Trinity force user would need a base AD of 125 (which, only 27 champions in the entire game has and that's at level 18 and even then only half of them actually buys Trinity Force) if it's supposed to be better than Duskblade.

273 from Duskblade versus 109 from Luden's Echo (assuming Luden's Echo is the only AP item the user has at this point).

I'll give you Titanic Hydra. The user only needs 1940 maximum health in order for it to be better than Duskblade and that's usually just gained through base health alone.

The Ravenous Hydra user would need 194 AD in addition to the AD already provided by Ravenous Hydra if it's supposed to be better than Duskblade.

273 from Duskblade versus 100 (200 if the attack crits) from Dead Man's Plate.

273 from Duskblade versus 277 from Hextech Gunblade (assuming Hextech Gunblade is the only AP item the user has at this point).

273 from Duskblade versus 280.5 (assuming the dash and all the bolts hit the same target) from Hextech Protobelt (assuming Hextech Protobelt is the only AP item the user has at this point).

273 from Duskblade versus 215 from Hextech GLP-800 (assuming Hextech GLP-800 is the only AP item the user has).

It's average, I agree, but it does bump it up quite a bit.

Out of all the items, only 4 beat it by themselves.

If removing it from the game isn't an option, I'd balance it like this:

Duskblade of Draktharr.

Cost: 2700 gold.

AD: 50.

Lethality: 15.

Cooldown Reduction: 10%.

UNIQUE PASSIVE â€“ NIGHTSTALKER: After being unseen for at least 1 second, your next basic attack against an enemy champion deals 25 - 250 (based on level) bonus on-hit physical damage and slows by 75% for 1 second. The enhanced attack lasts 5 seconds after being seen by an enemy champion.

1. AD reduced to 50 from 55.

2. Lethality decreased to 15 from 18.

3. Nightstalker damage changed to 25 - 250 (based on level) from 30 - 200 (based on level).

4. Slow percentage decreased to 75% from 99%.

4. Slow duration increased to 0.5 seconds from 0.25 seconds.

5. Blackout passive: Removed.

5. Gold cost decreased to 2700 gold from 2900 gold.

Basically, less damage early on so you don't get 100-0 once the enemy has Duskblade and you get snowballed on, little bit less armor pen so squishies can actually buy armor that matters and removing the free Sweeping Lens (Duskblade will still tell if you're in a bush that's warded so you can still pick up a Sweeping Lens and use it it in conjunction with that).

To compensate, you get more utility in a slow that lasts longer (albeit, it's total slow is reduced by a little bit), little bit more damage on the passive late game so you can fulfill your job and assassinate the backline, and you can get it just a little bit cheaper.

> 
> What i mean by ward camo is making it so, during the shield duration of edge of night, wards dont see you but players can. In this way it retains its use, stays pre-meditated, and doesnt break the item due to situational use. 
> The current automagic sweeper is quite generalist.

I don't know.

I'd rather just have it give regular camo at that point.

I think Lethality items as a whole need a pass. I think Riot should rework Duskblade, reduce overall Lethality on current Lethality items and add a new one so there are more options than just: I have enough damage to os anyway and my desire is to roam more - go Youmuu. I think I'm going to need extra damage to os soon and I want vision denial - go Duskblade. Whilst these options are fine, I wish there were more than just this as it's quite 1d.

> [{quoted}](name=Blade Or Soul,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OAU8xe6U,comment-id=00020000000000000000000000000002,timestamp=2018-08-12T08:39:22.909+0000)

How I'd do it:

1. Revert Duskblade back to it's previous Zed ult passive so squishies don't blow up immediately and have time to think and use stuff like Heals, Shields and Zhonya's.

2. Add Lifeline and Spectral Cutlass to Summoner's Rift. Remove the Lethality and reduce the AD to 15 from 20 on Lifeline. Reduce the AD on Spectral Cutlass to 55 from 70. Increase it's cooldown to 120 seconds from 60 seconds.

3. Reduce Lethality on all (completed) Lethality items to 15 from 18 (for a total of 60, rather than 72).

I'd revert Duskblade to the previous true damage iteration that scaled on your Lethality, including the cost etc. I think this was the healthiest the item ever was and it was only reworked for the sake of change. 

I wouldn't mind Spectral Cutlass to SR, it seems like they might be testing it for SR through other modes rn. 

I agree with this. I think this would be the healthy. Though I'd like to see Youmuu go up to 60 AD but cost 3k instead and to reduce EoN from 3.1k to 3k. I think the expensive Leth item should be Duskblade.

I would like for the Lethality items across the board to give more AD and slightly less Lethality, AD assassins tend to have rather high scalings, also this bring the Lethality items more in line with mage rushes. I think one of the most overbearing parts of Lethality right now is how cheap it is. 

The reason I want EoN to come down in price is because in practice it's proven to be the weakest Lethality item by a decent margin.

Here, ill show you. 
Shiv: 60-140 (can crit for 120-280), 2800g, 35% attack speed, 30% crit chance, 5% movement speed. 
RFC: 60-140 (Can stack with shiv) 2800g, 30% ASP, 30% crit, 5% MS

Beyond that, people will _always_ blame burst damage because "theres no counterplay", even if theres other champions who perform much better in general. 
MANY of its peers out-perform duskblade and even scale. Duskblade is flat damage.

All of these items (except for Shiv and RFC which requires other crit items to be bought with them in order to gain full effect) are also hundreds of gold more expensive, so it makes sense they give this amount of stats.

Assassins get all the stuff they need to snowball out of control cheaper than everyone else without having to sacrifice anything for it.

Take something like Lord Dominik's Regards.

ADCs sacrifice (flat) damage and tons of other useful stats like lifesteal and attack speed at the advantage of shredding Tanks.

Assassin... Don't need to sacrifice anything.

1. They get AD, which, not only increases their auto attack damage but also makes their spells (which have incredible ratios) deal even more damage.

2. They get armor pen, which, makes them deal even more damage.

3. They get cdr, which allows them to spam their shit more often.

4. They get EVEN MORE damage, if the previous wasn't enough.

5. They get minor cc so enemies can't just escape them.

6. They get a free Sweeping Lens.

All of this for less gold than anyone else.

Yes, it's going to get outscaled in the late game, but games are getting shorter and shorter so this late game doesn't happen half the time.

With the massive damage on Electrocute (which is getting nerfed, I know) and Ignite, early snowballs are incredibly important, moreso than scaling, and Duskblade does everything to increase early snowballs.
